alert.note: Alert for Bear Lake Valley; Bear River Range; Blackfoot Mountains; Caribou Range; Franklin, Eastern Oneida Region; Marsh and Arbon Highlands (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 8:47PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Caribou, southeastern Bannock, Franklin and Bear Lake Counties through 930 PM MDT... At 847 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Georgetown, or near Montpelier, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Preston, Montpelier, Bear Lake Idaho Portion, Grace, Franklin, Georgetown, Saint Charles, Dingle, Thatcher, Oneida Narrows Reservoir, Paris, Bloomington, Bern, Minnetonka Cave, Ovid, Border Summit, Mapleton, Georgetown Summit, Diamond Creek Campground, and Geneva. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If on or near Bear Lake, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.

area.areaDesc: Bear Lake Valley; Bear River Range; Blackfoot Mountains; Caribou Range; Franklin, Eastern Oneida Region; Marsh and Arbon Highlands
